alert.note: Alert for Inland Cameron; Inland Willacy; Southern Hidalgo (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 07 at 12:45PM CDT by NWS Brownsville
info.description: ...A strong cluster of thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Hidalgo, northwestern Cameron and southwestern Willacy Counties through 115 PM CDT... At 1244 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms over northwest Cameron County and southeastern Hidalgo County moving north or northwest at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Harlingen, Weslaco, San Benito, Donna, Mercedes, Raymondville, La Feria, Elsa, Progreso and Edcouch. This includes the following highways... Interstate Highway 69 E between mile markers 18 and 50. US Highway 281 between mile markers 800 and 814. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Inland Cameron; Inland Willacy; Southern Hidalgo
